speaker: user
message: How do we transfer revaluation surplus to retained earnings and when is that required?

speaker: agent
message:
**Revaluation Surplus Transfer to Retained Earnings - Ind AS 16 Guidance**

Under Ind AS 16, transfer of revaluation surplus to retained earnings is permitted (not mandatory) in two situations:

| Trigger | Transfer Amount | Accounting Entry |
|---|---|---|
| Asset is depreciated (depreciable assets) | Difference between depreciation on revalued amount and on historical cost | Dr Revaluation Reserve / Cr Retained Earnings |
| Asset is derecognised (sold/scrapped) | Remaining balance of revaluation reserve for that asset | Dr Revaluation Reserve / Cr Retained Earnings |

**Your Situation (Land - non-depreciable):**
- Land is not depreciated, so periodic transfer does not apply
- Transfer will occur only on disposal of the land parcels
- Factory land surplus: ₹310.00 lakhs — transfer on sale
- Nashik land surplus: ₹98.00 lakhs — transfer on sale

**Important:** Transfer from revaluation reserve to retained earnings does NOT pass through P&L (it is within equity). The reserve cannot be used for dividend distribution.
expected_agent_response_summary: Guidance on when and how to transfer revaluation surplus to retained earnings under Ind AS 16

| Aspect | Requirement |
|---|---|

| Identification basis | Engineering judgment + cost significance (typically >10% of asset cost) |
| Depreciation | Each component depreciated over its own useful life |
| Replacement | Cost of new component capitalised; carrying value of old component derecognised |

speaker: user
message: What are the GST implications if we sell or scrap a capital asset? Is there a deemed supply?

speaker: agent
message:
**GST Implications on Capital Asset Disposal**

| Scenario | GST Applicability | Basis |
|---|---|---|
| Sale of asset (used in business) | GST applicable on sale value OR transaction value | Schedule II - Supply of goods |
| Scrap / deemed disposal | GST on Fair Market Value (if ITC was availed) | Section 18(6) CGST Act |
| Asset fully depreciated (WDV = 0) | GST on transaction value / FMV at time of supply | Rule 40(2) CGST Rules |
| Asset gifted to employee | GST applies if value >₹50,000 per employee per year | Schedule I |

**If ITC was availed on asset:**
- GST payable = Higher of: (a) 5% per quarter remaining in 5-year period, or (b) actual transaction value
- Formula: ITC reversal = ITC × (60 - months used) / 60

**Example - If CNC Machine sold after 2 years:**
- ITC availed: ₹13,52,542
- Months remaining: 36 of 60
- Minimum reversal: ₹13,52,542 × 36/60 = ₹8,11,525
- Compare with actual GST on sale price — pay higher amount
expected_agent_response_summary: GST implications on capital asset disposal including deemed supply rules and ITC reversal calculations
